trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.CancelCommand"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.DeleteCommand"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.EditCommand"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.ItemCommand"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.UpdateCommand"></xref> events of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.CancelCommand> event is raised when the `Cancel` button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.DeleteCommand> event is raised when the `Delete` button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.EditCommand> event is raised when the `Edit` button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.ItemCommand> event is raised when any button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is clicked.
This allows you to programmatically test for when a specific command button is clicked and take appropriate action.
This event is commonly used to handle custom command buttons for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.UpdateCommand> event is raised when the `Update` button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is clicked.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListCommandEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListCommandEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListCommandEventArgs> class.
When an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListCommandEventArgs> is created by a call to this constructor, the following properties are initialized to the specified values.
Property
Initial Value
Item
The value of the `item` parameter.
CommandSource
The value of the `commandSource` parameter.
The selected item from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref>.
The source of the command.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> that contains the original event data.
Gets the source of the command.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property to determine the command source that raised the event.
This property is commonly used to determine which command raises the event.
You can then take appropriate action, based on the command.
The source of the command.
Gets the item containing the command source in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListCommandEventArgs.Item%2A> property to access information about the selected item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem"></xref> object that represents the selected item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> control.
